peter@area51.social at 2024-01-31T11:46:00.000Z ##

If you are running Jenkins 2.441 or LTS 2.426.2 and earlier, you'll probably need to upgrade, more so if your Jenkins instance is publicly accessible!

A critical issue with the Jenkins CLI potentially exposing files on the controller

CVE-2024-23897 https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-23897

It seems to be down to the args4j library

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/

#jenkins #cve

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T19:34:09.000Z ##

Horizon3 discusses factors that could significantly increase the criticality of Jenkins RCE CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical): "There are two dangerous Jenkins configuration options that allow unauthenticated attackers to effectively act like authenticated attackers. The “Allow users to sign up” option allows anyone with access to the Jenkins instance to self-register an account. And the “Allow anonymous read access” option gives everyone the Overall/Read permission." The impact matrix alone was worth taking a look at.
🔗 https://www.horizon3.ai/cve-2024-23897-assessing-the-impact-of-the-jenkins-arbitrary-file-leak-vulnerability/

#Jenkins #RCE #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/02/06/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##
simontsui at 2024-02-06T16:35:48.101Z ##

Note: CVE-2023-4762 was initially disclosed by Google in a security advisory on 05 September 2023 (reported anonymously). In a post from 22 September 2023 (17 days later), Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) assessed commercial spyware vendor Intellexa exploited CVE-2023-4762 as a zero-day:

The attacker also had an exploit chain to install Predator on Android devices in Egypt. TAG observed these exploits delivered in two different ways: the MITM injection and via one-time links sent directly to the target. We were only able to obtain the initial renderer remote code execution vulnerability for Chrome, which was exploiting CVE-2023-4762.

This bug had already been separately reported to the Chrome Vulnerability Rewards Program by a security researcher and was patched on September 5th. We assess that Intellexa was also previously using this vulnerability as a 0-day.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T16:35:48.000Z ##

Note: CVE-2023-4762 was initially disclosed by Google in a security advisory on 05 September 2023 (reported anonymously). In a post from 22 September 2023 (17 days later), Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) assessed commercial spyware vendor Intellexa exploited CVE-2023-4762 as a zero-day:

The attacker also had an exploit chain to install Predator on Android devices in Egypt. TAG observed these exploits delivered in two different ways: the MITM injection and via one-time links sent directly to the target. We were only able to obtain the initial renderer remote code execution vulnerability for Chrome, which was exploiting CVE-2023-4762.

This bug had already been separately reported to the Chrome Vulnerability Rewards Program by a security researcher and was patched on September 5th. We assess that Intellexa was also previously using this vulnerability as a 0-day.

CVE-2023-4863
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 38.33%

2 posts

Heap buffer overflow in libwebp allow a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page.

10 repos

https://github.com/OITApps/Find-VulnerableElectronVersion

https://github.com/alsaeroth/CVE-2023-4863-POC

https://github.com/mistymntncop/CVE-2023-4863

https://github.com/bbaranoff/CVE-2023-4863

https://github.com/LiveOverflow/webp-CVE-2023-4863

https://github.com/caoweiquan322/NotEnough

https://github.com/talbeerysec/BAD-WEBP-CVE-2023-4863

https://github.com/GTGalaxi/ElectronVulnerableVersion

https://github.com/Microsvuln/CVE-2023-4863

https://github.com/murphysecurity/libwebp-checker

catc0n at 2024-02-04T19:09:05.559Z ##

It's been a few months since last year's #libwebp 0day (#CVE_2023_4863) came out, and I'm curious about whether the alarm has ratcheted down. It kinda seemed like this was potentially a pretty bad vuln if you're a political dissident using Electron apps to organize against oppressive governments, but probably not a super dangerous situation for most corporate networks (with basically no chance of broad automated exploitation). But as I think @TomSellers pointed out early on, the tail of apps that use the vulnerable library was always going to be long, and that usually means it's hard to track just how many are/were exploitable out of the box, and that it could be years before high-impact (remote) attack vectors are identified and fixed.

This is a fantastic overview: https://blog.isosceles.com/the-webp-0day/

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-04T19:09:05.000Z ##

It's been a few months since last year's #libwebp 0day (#CVE_2023_4863) came out, and I'm curious about whether the alarm has ratcheted down. It kinda seemed like this was potentially a pretty bad vuln if you're a political dissident using Electron apps to organize against oppressive governments, but probably not a super dangerous situation for most corporate networks (with basically no chance of broad automated exploitation). But as I think @TomSellers pointed out early on, the tail of apps that use the vulnerable library was always going to be long, and that usually means it's hard to track just how many are/were exploitable out of the box, and that it could be years before high-impact (remote) attack vectors are identified and fixed.

This is a fantastic overview: https://blog.isosceles.com/the-webp-0day/

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC), aka 'Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'.

simontsui at 2024-02-08T15:50:32.215Z ##

Recorded Future has an 18 page report on Ransomware Exploitation of vulnerabilities for the past six years (2017). Here are the key findings:

  • Ransomware groups alone in exploiting three or more vulnerabilities exhibit a clear targeting focus, which defenders can use to prioritize security measures. For example, CL0P has uniquely and infamously focused on file transfer software from Accellion, SolarWinds, and MOVEit. Other ransomware groups with high levels of unique exploitation exhibit similar patterns.
  • All of the vulnerabilities ransomware groups have targeted most widely are in software frequently used by major enterprises and can be easily exploited via penetration testing modules or single lines of curl code. These vulnerabilities are ProxyShell (CVE-2021-34473, CVE-2021-34523, and CVE-2021-31207), ZeroLogon (CVE-2020-1472), Log4Shell (CVE-2021-44228), CVE-2021-34527, and CVE-2019-19781.
  • Vulnerabilities requiring unique or custom vectors to exploit (for example, malicious files using particular forms of compression) are more likely to be exploited by only one or two groups.
  • Ransomware operators and affiliates are highly unlikely to discuss specific vulnerabilities, but the cybercriminal ecosystem that supports them has discussed publicly known vulnerabilities andproducts as targets of interest for exploitation

🔗 https://www.recordedfuture.com/patterns-targets-ransomware-exploitation-vulnerabilities-2017-2023

#recordedfuture #ransomware #cybercrime #threatintel #cyberthreatintelligence #vulnerabilities

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T15:50:32.000Z ##

Recorded Future has an 18 page report on Ransomware Exploitation of vulnerabilities for the past six years (2017). Here are the key findings:

  • Ransomware groups alone in exploiting three or more vulnerabilities exhibit a clear targeting focus, which defenders can use to prioritize security measures. For example, CL0P has uniquely and infamously focused on file transfer software from Accellion, SolarWinds, and MOVEit. Other ransomware groups with high levels of unique exploitation exhibit similar patterns.
  • All of the vulnerabilities ransomware groups have targeted most widely are in software frequently used by major enterprises and can be easily exploited via penetration testing modules or single lines of curl code. These vulnerabilities are ProxyShell (CVE-2021-34473, CVE-2021-34523, and CVE-2021-31207), ZeroLogon (CVE-2020-1472), Log4Shell (CVE-2021-44228), CVE-2021-34527, and CVE-2019-19781.
  • Vulnerabilities requiring unique or custom vectors to exploit (for example, malicious files using particular forms of compression) are more likely to be exploited by only one or two groups.
  • Ransomware operators and affiliates are highly unlikely to discuss specific vulnerabilities, but the cybercriminal ecosystem that supports them has discussed publicly known vulnerabilities andproducts as targets of interest for exploitation

🔗 https://www.recordedfuture.com/patterns-targets-ransomware-exploitation-vulnerabilities-2017-2023

##

CVE-2023-36846
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 3.04%

1 posts

A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause limited impact to the file system integrity. With a specific request that doesn't require authentication an attacker is able to upload arbitrary files via J-Web, leading to a loss of integrity for a certain  part of the file syste

3 repos

https://github.com/r3dcl1ff/CVE-2023-36844_Juniper_RCE

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-36846

https://github.com/Dreamy-elfland/CVE-2023-36846

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T15:33:14.000Z ##

Juniper out-of-cycle security advisory for Junos OS SRX Series and EX Series:

  • CVE-2024-21619 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated information disclosure
  • CVE-2023-36846 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)
  • CVE-2024-21620 (8.8 high) improper neutralization of input (cross-site scripting)
  • CVE-2023-36851 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)

🔗 https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Out-of-Cycle-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Multiple-vulnerabilities-in-J-Web-have-been-addressed?language=en_US

##

CVE-2023-5178
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.49%

2 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drivers/nvme/target/tcp.c` in `nvmet_tcp_free_crypto` due to a logical bug in the NVMe-oF/TCP subsystem in the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause a use-after-free and double-free problem, which may permit remote code execution or lead to local privilege escalation in case that the attacker already has local privileges.

1 repos

https://github.com/rockrid3r/CVE-2023-5178

todb at 2024-02-02T15:58:07.235Z ##

CVE-2023-5178 is pretty neat.

But, the attacker can't arbitrarily surprise a victim into loading this nvme-tcp driver, though, right? In order to #exploit this bug, you need to already be in a position to send malformed PDU headers to the victim, so they already have to be using this stuff, and you (the attacker) are either already local, or spoofing the remote nvme controller, near as I can tell.

I know basically nothing about fibre channel storage protocols, but this one can run over #TCP so I got to digging into it. I wonder how popular it is for NAS. Seems pretty cool and lickety-split quick.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/10/15/1

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-5178

##
todb@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:58:07.000Z ##

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.1, watchOS 9.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1.

— Bleeping Computer

#Juniper #JunosOS #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21619 #CVE_2023_36846 #CVE_2024_21620 #CVE_2023_36851 #KEV #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

##

CVE-2023-36460
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.41%

2 posts

N/A

techbites@techbites.info at 2024-02-04T06:26:12.000Z ##

Decentralized social network Mastodon has revealed a significant security flaw, potentially allowing malicious actors to impersonate and take control of any account. The maintainers issued a concise advisory, stating that insufficient origin validation across all Mastodon versions enables this vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23832, the severity rating is 9.4 out of 10, and security researcher arcanicanis is credited with discovering and reporting it.

Described as an “origin validation error” (CWE-346), this flaw could grant attackers access to inadvertently accessible functionalities. Versions vulnerable include all Mastodon releases before 3.5.17, 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

To prevent exploitation, Mastodon has chosen to withhold detailed technical information until February 15, 2024. This delay allows administrators sufficient time to update server instances. The federated nature of Mastodon, operating on separate servers (instances), emphasizes the importance of timely security updates by administrators to safeguard against potential risks.

This disclosure follows Mastodon’s addressing of two critical flaws nearly seven months ago (CVE-2023-36460 and 2023-36459), emphasizing the ongoing commitment to enhancing platform security.

https://techbites.info/fediverse/critical-security-flaw-in-mastodon-exposes-account-takeover-risks/

#fediverse #Infosec #mastoadmin #mastodon #News #Privacy #security #tech

##
techbites@techbites.info at 2024-02-04T06:26:12.000Z ##

Decentralized social network Mastodon has revealed a significant security flaw, potentially allowing malicious actors to impersonate and take control of any account. The maintainers issued a concise advisory, stating that insufficient origin validation across all Mastodon versions enables this vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23832, the severity rating is 9.4 out of 10, and security researcher arcanicanis is credited with discovering and reporting it.

Described as an “origin validation error” (CWE-346), this flaw could grant attackers access to inadvertently accessible functionalities. Versions vulnerable include all Mastodon releases before 3.5.17, 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

To prevent exploitation, Mastodon has chosen to withhold detailed technical information until February 15, 2024. This delay allows administrators sufficient time to update server instances. The federated nature of Mastodon, operating on separate servers (instances), emphasizes the importance of timely security updates by administrators to safeguard against potential risks.

This disclosure follows Mastodon’s addressing of two critical flaws nearly seven months ago (CVE-2023-36460 and 2023-36459), emphasizing the ongoing commitment to enhancing platform security.

https://techbites.info/fediverse/critical-security-flaw-in-mastodon-exposes-account-takeover-risks/

#fediverse #Infosec #mastoadmin #mastodon #News #Privacy #security #tech

CVE-2014-0016(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.34%

2 posts

stunnel before 5.00, when using fork threading, does not properly update the state of the OpenSSL pseudo-random number generator (PRNG), which causes subsequent children with the same process ID to use the same entropy pool and allows remote attackers to obtain private keys for EC (ECDSA) or DSA certificates.

emaste@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T22:30:01.000Z ##

@simondassow @gyptazy E.g. in a writeup for CVE-2014-0016 and CVE-2014-0017:

> OSes with sequential PID generation are then less vulnerable than OSes with random PID (AFAIK only OpenBSD).

A vulnerability in the web services interface of Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve memory contents on an affected device, which could lead to the disclosure of confidential information. The vulnerability is due to a buffer tracking issue when the software parses invalid URLs

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T04:49:31.000Z ##

🚨 patch your Cisco AnyConnect boxes 🚨

For a 2020 vulnerability. Really.

Lots of ransomware cases coming in for Cisco AnyConnect/ASA recently and find finally we know how - CVE-2020-3259

It was a vuln which allowed a CitrixBleed style memory dump, found by a Russian research org now under US sanctions. Ransomware operators have an exploit.

Sadly it looks like many orgs never patched.

https://www.truesec.com/hub/blog/akira-ransomware-and-exploitation-of-cisco-anyconnect-vulnerability-cve-2020-3259

A file in PKCS12 format can contain certificates and keys and may come from an untrusted source. The PKCS12 specification allows certain fields to be

##

CVE-2024-20652
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.20%

2 posts

Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-01-30T19:12:43.047Z ##

@GossiTheDog this sounded very familiar to something I read in an Akamai blog post, and whaddayaknow, Ben Barnea is that same security researcher at Akamai who reported it:

Akamai researcher Ben Barnea found CVE-2024-20652, a security feature bypass vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability itself is in MapUrlToZone, which is a function that is usually called to determine if a URL points to a resource on the machine, inside the network, or on the internet.

This vulnerability is similar to previously disclosed vulnerabilities. It causes MapUrlToZone to conclude that a URL resides in the intranet, while the URL actually points to an internet resource. This can be abused to bypass Outlook’s CVE-2023-23397 patch, and eventually lead to leaking NTLM credentials to a remote (attacker-controlled) destination."

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T19:12:43.000Z ##

@GossiTheDog this sounded very familiar to something I read in an Akamai blog post, and whaddayaknow, Ben Barnea is that same security researcher at Akamai who reported it:

Akamai researcher Ben Barnea found CVE-2024-20652, a security feature bypass vulnerability with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability itself is in MapUrlToZone, which is a function that is usually called to determine if a URL points to a resource on the machine, inside the network, or on the internet.

This vulnerability is similar to previously disclosed vulnerabilities. It causes MapUrlToZone to conclude that a URL resides in the intranet, while the URL actually points to an internet resource. This can be abused to bypass Outlook’s CVE-2023-23397 patch, and eventually lead to leaking NTLM credentials to a remote (attacker-controlled) destination."

##

CVE-2024-23222
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.18%

2 posts

A type confusion issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

simontsui at 2024-01-31T18:47:21.429Z ##

Apple Vision Pro won't officially release until 02 February 2024 and it already has an actively exploited zero-day
CVE-2024-23222: A type confusion issue in WebKit was addressed with improved checks. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.
(as noted by others, this was disclosed 22 January 2024 by Apple across multiple products and added to the CISA KEV Catalog 23 January)
🔗 https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214070

#Apple #vulnerability #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_23222 #VisionPro #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

##

##

CVE-2023-40547
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.17%

7 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability was found in Shim. The Shim boot support trusts attacker-controlled values when parsing an HTTP response. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a specific malicious HTTP request, leading to a completely controlled out-of-bounds write primitive and complete system compromise.

parvXtl@tech.lgbt at 2024-02-07T07:22:05.000Z ##

Need to be able to set booting over HTTP ...

Critical #vulnerability [#CVE2023_40547] affecting most Linux distros allows for bootkits: #BufferOverflow in #bootloader shim allows attackers to run code each time devices boot up, 20240206,
by Dan G,
https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/02/critical-vulnerability-affecting-most-linux-distros-allows-for-bootkits/
#UEFI #secureBoot

##

harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-26T20:10:01.000Z ##

Linux shim has a heap buffer overflow #vulnerability CVE-2023-40547 that allows arbitrary code execution and full system compromise when attacker is able to control the HTTP response.

Fixed in commit https://github.com/rhboot/shim/commit/0226b56513b2b8bd5fd281bce77c40c9bf07c66d as part of https://github.com/rhboot/shim/releases/tag/15.8 #cve #infosec

##

CVE-2022-44117
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.12%

2 posts

Boa 0.94.14rc21 is vulnerable to SQL Injection via username.

TomSellers at 2024-02-01T20:23:50.994Z ##

Text of CVE-2022-44117 is:

Boa 0.94.14rc21 is vulnerable to SQL Injection via username.

Given what the Boa webserver does this CVE is probably BS. There are multiple other CVEs that have been disputed for the same reason.

Updates to Boa stopped in 2005 so, like, your probably not doing great if it is in your environment but lets not falsely assign blame.

#security

##
TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:23:50.000Z ##

Text of CVE-2022-44117 is:

Boa 0.94.14rc21 is vulnerable to SQL Injection via username.

Given what the Boa webserver does this CVE is probably BS. There are multiple other CVEs that have been disputed for the same reason.

Updates to Boa stopped in 2005 so, like, your probably not doing great if it is in your environment but lets not falsely assign blame.

  • CVE-2024-21619 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated information disclosure

##

CVE-2024-0517
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

2 posts

Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.224 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-02-05T14:25:52.960Z ##

Exodus Intelligence provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-0517, (8.8 high severity, disclosed 16 January by Google) an out of bounds write vulnerability in V8. This vulnerability arose due to how V8’s Maglev compiler tried to optimize the number of allocations that it makes. Exodus was able to exploit this bug by leveraging V8’s garbage collector to gain read/write in the V8 heap. They then used a Wasm instance object in V8, which still has a raw 64-bit pointer to the Wasm RWX memory to bypass Ubercage and gain code execution inside the Chrome sandbox. CVE-2024-0517 was upstaged by 0519 (8.8 high Out of bounds memory access in V8) which was announced as exploited in the wild.

"Apart from fixing the vulnerability, an upstream V8 commit was recently introduced to move the WASM instance into a new Trusted Space, thereby rendering this method of bypassing the Ubercage ineffective."

🔗 https://blog.exodusintel.com/2024/01/19/google-chrome-v8-cve-2024-0517-out-of-bounds-write-code-execution/

#CVE_2024_0517 #Google #Chrome #vulnerability #RCA #poc

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T14:25:52.000Z ##

Exodus Intelligence provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-0517, (8.8 high severity, disclosed 16 January by Google) an out of bounds write vulnerability in V8. This vulnerability arose due to how V8’s Maglev compiler tried to optimize the number of allocations that it makes. Exodus was able to exploit this bug by leveraging V8’s garbage collector to gain read/write in the V8 heap. They then used a Wasm instance object in V8, which still has a raw 64-bit pointer to the Wasm RWX memory to bypass Ubercage and gain code execution inside the Chrome sandbox. CVE-2024-0517 was upstaged by 0519 (8.8 high Out of bounds memory access in V8) which was announced as exploited in the wild.

"Apart from fixing the vulnerability, an upstream V8 commit was recently introduced to move the WASM instance into a new Trusted Space, thereby rendering this method of bypassing the Ubercage ineffective."

🔗 https://blog.exodusintel.com/2024/01/19/google-chrome-v8-cve-2024-0517-out-of-bounds-write-code-execution/

#CVE_2024_0517 #Google #Chrome #vulnerability #RCA #poc

##

CVE-2022-39046
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

2 posts

An issue was discovered in the GNU C Library (glibc) 2.36. When the syslog function is passed a crafted input string larger than 1024 bytes, it reads uninitialized memory from the heap and prints it to the target log file, potentially revealing a portion of the contents of the heap.

jyn@tech.lgbt at 2024-02-01T04:31:09.000Z ##

@hierarchon @cadey

This heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was inadvertently introduced in glibc 2.37 (August 2022) and subsequently backported to glibc 2.36 while addressing a different, less severe vulnerability (CVE-2022-39046).

nooooooo

##
jyn@tech.lgbt at 2024-02-01T04:31:09.000Z ##

@hierarchon @cadey

This heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was inadvertently introduced in glibc 2.37 (August 2022) and subsequently backported to glibc 2.36 while addressing a different, less severe vulnerability (CVE-2022-39046).

nooooooo

CVE-2023-34992
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

6 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.0.0 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.5 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.1 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted API requests.

simontsui at 2024-02-08T03:29:22.429Z ##

Fortinet lied after hiding vulnerabilities in an old advisory: @hacks_zach of Horizon3 posted a screenshot of his email with Fortinet PSIRT showing that he submitted CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109. These are patch bypass vulnerabilities of CVE-2023-34992, according to a new and updated Bleeping Computer article.
🔗 Zach Hanley tweet: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695/photo/1
Bleeping Computer article: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM #CVE_2023_34992

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T03:29:22.000Z ##

Fortinet lied after hiding vulnerabilities in an old advisory: @hacks_zach of Horizon3 posted a screenshot of his email with Fortinet PSIRT showing that he submitted CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109. These are patch bypass vulnerabilities of CVE-2023-34992, according to a new and updated Bleeping Computer article.
🔗 Zach Hanley tweet: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695/photo/1

@simontsui Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992.

Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating.

CVE-2023-6129
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

2 posts

Issue summary: The POLY1305 MAC (message authentication code) implementation contains a bug that might corrupt the internal state of applications running on PowerPC CPU based platforms if the CPU provides vector instructions. Impact summary: If an attacker can influence whether the POLY1305 MAC algorithm is used, the application state might be corrupted with various application dependent conseque

It's flagging multiple devices (all Intel laptops running Windows 10) as vulnerable to CVE-2023-6129, which is specific to PowerPC architecture. If they spent less time flagging OpenSSL issues which are not exploitable and more time looking after their own code/infrastructure I'd be happy. #microsoftdefender #microsoftsecurity

CVE-2021-4034
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

4 posts

A local privilege escalation vulnerability was found on polkit's pkexec utility. The pkexec application is a setuid tool designed to allow unprivileged users to run commands as privileged users according predefined policies. The current version of pkexec doesn't handle the calling parameters count correctly and ends trying to execute environment variables as commands. An attacker can leverage this

https://github.com/dzonerzy/poc-cve-2021-4034

simontsui at 2024-02-05T16:32:45.885Z ##

Akamai provided details about a new variant of the FritzFrog botnet, which abuses the 2021 Log4Shell vulnerability CVE-2021-44228 (10.0 critical). The vulnerability is exploited in a brute-force manner that attempts to target as many vulnerable Java applications as possible. The malware also now also includes a module to exploit CVE-2021-4034, a privilege escalation in the polkit Linux component. This module enables the malware to run as root on vulnerable servers. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/2024/feb/fritzfrog-botnet-new-capabilities-log4shell

#FritzFrog #botnet #IOC #Log4Shell #CVE_2021_44228 #CVE_2021_4034 #threatintel #IOC

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-05T16:32:45.000Z ##

CVE-2024-22771
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

simontsui at 2024-01-30T17:44:17.189Z ##

In CISA's ICS advisory, they revealed that several Hitron Systems Security Camera DVR denial of service vulnerabilities were being actively exploited. These are Zero days reported by Akamai.

  • CVE-2024-22768 (7.4 high) improper input validation to Denial of Service
  • CVE-2024-22769 (7.4 high) improper input validation to Denial of Service
  • CVE-2024-22770 (7.4 high) improper input validation to Denial of Service
  • CVE-2024-22771 (7.4 high) improper input validation to Denial of Service
  • CVE-2024-22772 (7.4 high) improper input validation to Denial of Service
  • CVE-2024-23842 (7.4 high) improper input validation to Denial of Service

CVE-2024-21620
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

2 posts

An Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series and EX Series allows an attacker to construct a URL that when visited by another user enables the attacker to execute commands with the target's permissions, including an administrator. A specific invocation of the emit_debug_note method in weba

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T12:09:23.000Z ##

The vulnerabilities, tracked as CVE-2024-21619 and CVE-2024-21620, are rooted in the J-Web component and impact all versions of Junos OS. https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/juniper-networks-releases-urgent-junos.html

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-29T15:33:14.000Z ##

Juniper out-of-cycle security advisory for Junos OS SRX Series and EX Series:

  • CVE-2024-21619 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated information disclosure
  • CVE-2023-36846 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)
  • CVE-2024-21620 (8.8 high) improper neutralization of input (cross-site scripting)
  • CVE-2023-36851 (5.3 medium) unauthenticated remote impact to file system integrity (note: added to KEV Catalog on 13 November 2023)

🔗 https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Out-of-Cycle-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Multiple-vulnerabilities-in-J-Web-have-been-addressed?language=en_US

#Juniper #JunosOS #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21619 #CVE_2023_36846 #CVE_2024_21620 #CVE_2023_36851 #KEV #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA

(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

The Image Protector WordPress plugin through 1.1 does not properly sanitize some of its settings, which could allow high-privilege users to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).

Oktober Patches. Tenable hat am 11. September davor gewarnt: https://www.tenable.com/blog/cve-2023-20269-zero-day-vulnerability-in-cisco-asa-and-ftd-reportedly-exploited-ransomware-groups

##

CVE-2023-36661(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

Shibboleth XMLTooling before 3.2.4, as used in OpenSAML and Shibboleth Service Provider, allows SSRF via a crafted KeyInfo element. (This is fixed in, for example, Shibboleth Service Provider 3.4.1.3 on Windows.)

catc0n at 2024-02-02T20:26:10.860Z ##

Via @stephenfewer: "We can note that the version of xmltooling being used is 3.0.2, which is several releases out of date. Searching online for SSRF vulnerabilities in the xmltooling library uncovers CVE-2023-36661, an SSRF vulnerability via a crafted KeyInfo element in xmltooling affecting all version of the library before 3.2.4. The vendor Shibboleth published an advisory with some more details on June 12, 2023." https://shibboleth.net/community/advisories/secadv_20230612.txt

##

CVE-2023-45779
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

In TBD of TBD, there is a possible malicious update to platform components due to improperly used crypto. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

1 repos

https://github.com/metaredteam/rtx-cve-2023-45779

jbhall56 at 2024-02-01T13:08:55.461Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-45779, the flaw was discovered by Meta's Red Team X in early September 2023 and was addressed in Android's December 2023 security update without disclosing details an attacker could use to discern and exploit it. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-android-local-elevation-flaw-impacting-7-oems/

##
MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-01-30T16:31:57.000Z ##

The technical write-up for CVE-2023-45779 has been published by Tom Hebb of Meta's Red Team X, revealing that several Android OEMs such as ASUS, Fairphone, Lenovo, Microsoft, Nokia, Nothing, and Vivo, were signing some of their APEX modules with the test keys publicly available in AOSP.

This would have allowed a user or attacker (with shell privileges) to forge an APEX update to "gain near-total control over [the device]."

(1/3)

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T13:08:55.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-45779, the flaw was discovered by Meta's Red Team X in early September 2023 and was addressed in Android's December 2023 security update without disclosing details an attacker could use to discern and exploit it. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-android-local-elevation-flaw-impacting-7-oems/

##
MishaalRahman@androiddev.social at 2024-01-30T16:31:57.000Z ##

The technical write-up for CVE-2023-45779 has been published by Tom Hebb of Meta's Red Team X, revealing that several Android OEMs such as ASUS, Fairphone, Lenovo, Microsoft, Nokia, Nothing, and Vivo, were signing some of their APEX modules with the test keys publicly available in AOSP.

This would have allowed a user or attacker (with shell privileges) to forge an APEX update to "gain near-total control over [the device]."

(1/3)

##

CVE-2014-0017(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

The RAND_bytes function in libssh before 0.6.3, when forking is enabled, does not properly reset the state of the OpenSSL pseudo-random number generator (PRNG), which causes the state to be shared between children processes and allows local users to obtain sensitive information by leveraging a pid collision.

emaste@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T22:30:01.000Z ##

@simondassow @gyptazy E.g. in a writeup for CVE-2014-0016 and CVE-2014-0017:

> OSes with sequential PID generation are then less vulnerable than OSes with random PID (AFAIK only OpenBSD).

https://blog.0xbadc0de.be/archives/218#more-218

##
emaste@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T22:30:01.000Z ##

@simondassow @gyptazy E.g. in a writeup for CVE-2014-0016 and CVE-2014-0017:

> OSes with sequential PID generation are then less vulnerable than OSes with random PID (AFAIK only OpenBSD).

https://blog.0xbadc0de.be/archives/218#more-218

##

CVE-2023-43787
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an integer overflow within the XCreateImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T06:19:17.000Z ##

*nix #libX11: Uncovering and exploiting a 35-year-old #vulnerability – Part 2 of 2

https://jfrog.com/blog/xorg-libx11-vulns-cve-2023-43786-cve-2023-43787-part-two/

##

CVE-2023-43786
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an infinite loop within the PutSubImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to consume all available system resources and cause a denial of service condition.

1 repos

https://github.com/jfrog/jfrog-CVE-2023-43786-libX11_DoS

raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-30T06:19:17.000Z ##

*nix #libX11: Uncovering and exploiting a 35-year-old #vulnerability – Part 2 of 2

https://jfrog.com/blog/xorg-libx11-vulns-cve-2023-43786-cve-2023-43787-part-two/

##

CVE-2024-23832
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

87 posts

Mastodon is a free, open-source social network server based on ActivityPub Mastodon allows configuration of LDAP for authentication. Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior

shanie@tails.ch at 2024-02-07T16:47:33.000Z ##

@vmstan They will soon be full of bots imitating their users (#CVE202423832) promoting literal garbage, phishing, spam.

Why would I stay federated with an instance whose admins don't care about their own instance or users?

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-02-07T16:20:59.000Z ##

Here's a great example of why the the update notifications built into Mastodon 4.2 are such a helpful feature to keep the network secure.

89% of 4.2 instances are secured against #CVE202423832 while only 16% of 4.1 instances are secured.

#MastoAdmin

🦣 Mastodon Exploit Allows for Remote Impersonation and Takeover
— wedistribute.org

"Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account.

Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5."

https://wedistribute.org/2024/02/mastodon-remote-takeover/

##
deltatux@infosec.town at 2024-02-05T21:16:00.579Z ##

A new vulnerability in Mastodon was disclosed allowing attackers to perform account takeovers if they successfully exploit this vulnerability.

This vulnerability is being tracked as CVE-2024-23832 & has a 9.4/10 CVSS3 score, so it's a critical vulnerability.

As always, if you run a Mastodon instance, it's best if you can patch to the latest version as soon as possible.

www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/mastodon-vulnerability-allows-attackers-to-take-over-accounts/

#mastoadmin #mastodon #fediverse #patch #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23832

##
fj@mastodon.social at 2024-02-01T15:53:15.000Z ##

Thank you @arcanicanis for making us users on here safer and reporting this critical Mastodon vulnerability.

And @Gargron and team for the prompt fix and patching of mastodon.social.

If your instance isn't patched, you should probably ping your admin.

"Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account.”

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw

#Mastodon #MastoSec #CVE_2024_23832 #MastoAdmin

##
SolamenteItan@masto.es at 2024-02-05T07:38:53.000Z ##

@davidochobits

Información sobre vulnerabilidad crítica CVE-2024-23832 en INCIBE-CERT: <https://www.incibe.es/incibe-cert/alerta-temprana/vulnerabilidades/cve-2024-23832>

##
techbites@techbites.info at 2024-02-04T06:26:12.000Z ##

Decentralized social network Mastodon has revealed a significant security flaw, potentially allowing malicious actors to impersonate and take control of any account. The maintainers issued a concise advisory, stating that insufficient origin validation across all Mastodon versions enables this vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23832, the severity rating is 9.4 out of 10, and security researcher arcanicanis is credited with discovering and reporting it.

Described as an “origin validation error” (CWE-346), this flaw could grant attackers access to inadvertently accessible functionalities. Versions vulnerable include all Mastodon releases before 3.5.17, 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

To prevent exploitation, Mastodon has chosen to withhold detailed technical information until February 15, 2024. This delay allows administrators sufficient time to update server instances. The federated nature of Mastodon, operating on separate servers (instances), emphasizes the importance of timely security updates by administrators to safeguard against potential risks.

This disclosure follows Mastodon’s addressing of two critical flaws nearly seven months ago (CVE-2023-36460 and 2023-36459), emphasizing the ongoing commitment to enhancing platform security.

https://techbites.info/fediverse/critical-security-flaw-in-mastodon-exposes-account-takeover-risks/

#fediverse #Infosec #mastoadmin #mastodon #News #Privacy #security #tech

##
toor@citydweller.social at 2024-02-04T00:17:41.000Z ##

Something different - if you run an older version of #Mastodon, please upgrade asap. There is a security problem which could allow others to take over accounts.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-23832

One of the things I don't like is that services like #FediDB actually collect version information so you can just ask the service "give me all the vulnerable servers." The .well-known/ link tells you the version.

makpikts@toot.lv at 2024-02-03T22:28:12.000Z ##

Tux_Free@mastodon.social at 2024-02-03T21:58:00.000Z ##

🚨ATENCIÓN🚨
Información importante para todo el fediverso

#Mastodon ha revelado una falla de seguridad crítica que permite a actores maliciosos hacerse pasar por cualquier cuenta y apoderarse de ella.

La #vulnerabilidad, registrada como CVE-2024-23832 , tiene una clasificación de gravedad de 9,4

Leer articulo completo: 👇

https://thehackernews.com/2024/02/mastodon-vulnerability-allows-hackers.html?m=1

##
hyde@lazybear.social at 2024-02-03T15:36:14.000Z ##

Don't forget to update to the latest #mastodon version! There is a vuln that allows attackers to hijack accounts (CVE-2024-23832)

##
mastodon.isbrill.com@mastodon.isbrill.com at 2024-02-03T14:45:28.000Z ##

A vulnerability in Mastodon’s origin validation has been discovered. Admins are urged to update to fix this flaw as soon as possible.

With a 9.4 severity score, exploiting CVE-2024-23832 potentially allows attackers to take over Mastodon accounts remotely.

Critical vulnerability in Mastodon is pounced upon by fast-acting admins, The Register

Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as are 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

“Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account,” the maintainers said in a terse advisory.

Mastodon Vulnerability Allows Hackers to Hijack Any Decentralized Account, The Hacker News

Devs are keeping the exact details private so that admins have a few weeks to upgrade and patch the problem.

https://mastodon.isbrill.com/mastodon-news/mastodon-vulnerability-admins-must-update-with-urgency/

#accounts #hackers #patch #vulnerability

##
hyoyoshikawa@toot.blue at 2024-02-03T08:54:21.000Z ##

mastodonの今回の緊急アップデート（v4.2.5）は以下の脆弱性（CVE-2024-23832）に緊急の対応が必要なため実施されました。未アップデートの鯖管理者は参考にしてください。

--------
CVE-2024-23832は、分散型ソーシャルネットワークプラットフォームであるMastodonに存在する重大な脆弱性です。この脆弱性により、攻撃者は不十分な起源検証のために、任意のMastodonアカウントをなりすまし、乗っ取ることが可能になります。問題は、認証リクエストの起源を適切に検証していない点にあります。

この脆弱性は、Mastodonの3.5.17より前のすべてのバージョンに影響し、4.0.x、4.1.x、4.2.xシリーズのバージョンも、それぞれ4.0.13、4.1.13、4.2.5より前のバージョンが影響を受けています

#脆弱性
#v4_2_5

##
ottoto2017@prattohome.com at 2024-02-03T08:11:30.000Z ##

「マストドンの脆弱性により、ハッカーは分散型アカウントを乗っ取ることができる 」： The Hacker News

「この脆弱性は CVE-2024-23832 として追跡され、重大度の評価は最大 10 段階中 9.4 です。この脆弱性の発見と報告は、セキュリティ研究者の arcanicanis が行ったとされています。

これは「オリジン検証エラー」( CWE-346 )として説明されており 、通常、攻撃者が「ソースに誤ってアクセスできるあらゆる機能にアクセス」できる可能性があります。

3.5.17 より前のすべての Mastodon バージョンには脆弱性があり、4.0.13 より前の 4.0.x バージョン、4.1.13 より前の 4.1.x バージョン、4.2.5 より前の 4.2.x バージョンも同様です。

この欠陥に関する追加の技術的詳細は2024年2月15日まで差し控える 」

更新期限は 2/15 まで。
v4.2.5 に #update 必要。

https://thehackernews.com/2024/02/mastodon-vulnerability-allows-hackers.html

#prattohome #TheHackerNews

##
ottoto2017@prattohome.com at 2024-02-03T02:52:56.000Z ##

「マストドンの重大な脆弱性が迅速な管理者によって襲われる 」： The Register

「重大度スコアは 9.4 で、CVE-2024-23832 を悪用すると、攻撃者がリモートから Mastodon アカウントを乗っ取ることができる可能性があります。

技術的な詳細についてはほとんど公開されていませんが、攻撃者がエクスプロイトを考案する前に管理者がパッチを適用する時間を確保していますが、これほど高い CVSS スコアを持つ脆弱性は、影響を受ける製品に重大な影響を与える傾向があり、多くの場合、比較的簡単に悪用されます。 」

v4.2.5 への #update がひつようです。

ところで、 #Mastodon はセキュリティ対応が色々出ていますが、他の #Fediverse アプリはセキュリティリスクにどうやって対処しているのでしょうか。あまり聞きませんが、コードがある以上、セキュリティリスクとは隣り合わせのはずですが。

https://www.theregister.com/2024/02/02/critical_vulnerability_in_mastodon_is/

#prattohome #TheRegister

vk6flab@mastodon.radio at 2024-02-02T19:51:20.000Z ##

A CVE with a 9.4 severity is NOT GOOD.

https://securityonline.info/mastodon-alert-cve-2024-23832-unlocks-account-takeover-threat/

Mastodon allows configuration of LDAP for authentication. Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5.

##
anthropy@mastodon.derg.nz at 2024-02-01T19:41:59.000Z ##

With the advent of a security vulnerability in Mastodon CVE-2024-23832, I see a lot of people (finally) updating their servers. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5.

If you run into issues after doing upgrades, here's a quick thing I slapped together detailing some of the things that can go wrong with usual upgrades/migrations, and how to fix them: https://derg.nz/dragonhive/web/sysadmin/kb/blog/2023/10/02/how-to-fix-mastodon.html

- Fix insufficient origin validation (CVE-2024-23832, GHSA-3fjr-858r-92rw)

##
ron@social.amichan.de at 2024-02-01T18:03:48.000Z ##

Heute muss ein dringendes Mastodon-Sicherheits-Update eingespielt werden.
Mastodon selbst meint dazu: **This release is an important security release fixing a critical security issue (CVE-2024-23832).**

Die Schritte sind einfach:

sudo su mastodon
cd /home/mastodon/live
git fetch --tags
git checkout v4.2.5
bundle install
yarn install --frozen-lockfile
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails assets:precompile
exit
sudo systemctl restart mastodon-sidekiq
sudo systemctl reload mastodon-web
sudo systemctl restart mastodon-streaming

Danach meldet die Oberfläche das Update auf 4.2.5
Achtung: ich bin von 4.2.4 auf die neue Version gegangen. Ggf muss man, wenn man von einer früheren version installiert andere Schritte vornehmen!

Vielen Dank an Hagen (@hbauer) Für die Info zum Update.

#mastodon #update #securityfix #anleitung

CVE-2024-23832

##
SolamenteItan@masto.es at 2024-02-05T07:38:53.000Z ##

@davidochobits

Información sobre vulnerabilidad crítica CVE-2024-23832 en INCIBE-CERT: <https://www.incibe.es/incibe-cert/alerta-temprana/vulnerabilidades/cve-2024-23832>

##
techbites@techbites.info at 2024-02-04T06:26:12.000Z ##

Decentralized social network Mastodon has revealed a significant security flaw, potentially allowing malicious actors to impersonate and take control of any account. The maintainers issued a concise advisory, stating that insufficient origin validation across all Mastodon versions enables this vulnerability. Tracked as CVE-2024-23832, the severity rating is 9.4 out of 10, and security researcher arcanicanis is credited with discovering and reporting it.

Described as an “origin validation error” (CWE-346), this flaw could grant attackers access to inadvertently accessible functionalities. Versions vulnerable include all Mastodon releases before 3.5.17, 4.0.x versions before 4.0.13, 4.1.x versions before 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions before 4.2.5.

To prevent exploitation, Mastodon has chosen to withhold detailed technical information until February 15, 2024. This delay allows administrators sufficient time to update server instances. The federated nature of Mastodon, operating on separate servers (instances), emphasizes the importance of timely security updates by administrators to safeguard against potential risks.

This disclosure follows Mastodon’s addressing of two critical flaws nearly seven months ago (CVE-2023-36460 and 2023-36459), emphasizing the ongoing commitment to enhancing platform security.

https://techbites.info/fediverse/critical-security-flaw-in-mastodon-exposes-account-takeover-risks/

#fediverse #Infosec #mastoadmin #mastodon #News #Privacy #security #tech

##
makpikts@toot.lv at 2024-02-03T22:28:12.000Z ##

@atis Par citu tēmu: kā mums ar CVE-2024-23832 ?

##
hyde@lazybear.social at 2024-02-03T15:36:14.000Z ##

Don't forget to update to the latest #mastodon version! There is a vuln that allows attackers to hijack accounts (CVE-2024-23832)

##
hyoyoshikawa@toot.blue at 2024-02-03T08:54:21.000Z ##

mastodonの今回の緊急アップデート（v4.2.5）は以下の脆弱性（CVE-2024-23832）に緊急の対応が必要なため実施されました。未アップデートの鯖管理者は参考にしてください。

--------
CVE-2024-23832は、分散型ソーシャルネットワークプラットフォームであるMastodonに存在する重大な脆弱性です。この脆弱性により、攻撃者は不十分な起源検証のために、任意のMastodonアカウントをなりすまし、乗っ取ることが可能になります。問題は、認証リクエストの起源を適切に検証していない点にあります。

この脆弱性は、Mastodonの3.5.17より前のすべてのバージョンに影響し、4.0.x、4.1.x、4.2.xシリーズのバージョンも、それぞれ4.0.13、4.1.13、4.2.5より前のバージョンが影響を受けています

#脆弱性
#v4_2_5

##
vk6flab@mastodon.radio at 2024-02-02T19:51:20.000Z ##

@EI3JDB @M0YNG

A CVE with a 9.4 severity is NOT GOOD.

https://securityonline.info/mastodon-alert-cve-2024-23832-unlocks-account-takeover-threat/

Mastodon allows configuration of LDAP for authentication. Due to insufficient origin validation in all Mastodon, attackers can impersonate and take over any remote account. Every Mastodon version prior to 3.5.17 is vulnerable, as well as 4.0.x versions prior to 4.0.13, 4.1.x version prior to 4.1.13, and 4.2.x versions prior to 4.2.5.

##

CVE-2023-6779
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

An off-by-one heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when these functions are called with a message bigger than INT_MAX bytes, leading to an incorrect calculation of the buffer size to store the message, resulting in an application crash. This issue affects glibc 2.

CitizenFortress@social.chiefgyk3d.com at 2024-02-07T15:49:55.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-20290
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

A vulnerability in the OLE2 file format parser of ClamAV could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to an incorrect check for end-of-string values during scanning, which may result in a heap buffer over-read. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting a crafted file containing OLE2

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-08T09:16:18.539Z ##

😈​ ClamAV 1.3.0 feature release and 1.2.2, 1.0.5 security patch release! 😈​

A vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-20290 was identified in the OLE2 file format parser of ClamAV, a widely used open-source antivirus engine. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to trigger a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. The core issue arises from an incorrect check for end-of-string values during the scanning process, leading to a potential heap buffer over-read. An attacker can exploit this flaw by sending a specially crafted file containing OLE2 content to be scanned by ClamAV on the targeted device. Successful exploitation would cause the ClamAV scanning process to terminate unexpectedly, resulting in a DoS condition that consumes available system resources.

The vulnerability has been given a CVSS v3 base score of 7.5, indicating a high severity level. The scoring reflects the following characteristics: the attack vector is network-based, the complexity of the attack is low, no privileges are required to exploit it, and no user interaction is needed. The primary impact is on the availability of the affected system, with no direct impact on confidentiality or integrity.

Cisco, the organization behind ClamAV, has acknowledged the issue and released software updates to address the vulnerability. There are no known workarounds that could mitigate this vulnerability, emphasizing the importance of applying the available patches to prevent potential attacks.

For further details on this vulnerability and the associated fixes, refer to the official advisories from Cisco

#ClamAV #CVE202420290 #cisco

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T09:16:18.000Z ##

😈​ ClamAV 1.3.0 feature release and 1.2.2, 1.0.5 security patch release! 😈​

A vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-20290 was identified in the OLE2 file format parser of ClamAV, a widely used open-source antivirus engine. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to trigger a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. The core issue arises from an incorrect check for end-of-string values during the scanning process, leading to a potential heap buffer over-read. An attacker can exploit this flaw by sending a specially crafted file containing OLE2 content to be scanned by ClamAV on the targeted device. Successful exploitation would cause the ClamAV scanning process to terminate unexpectedly, resulting in a DoS condition that consumes available system resources.

The vulnerability has been given a CVSS v3 base score of 7.5, indicating a high severity level. The scoring reflects the following characteristics: the attack vector is network-based, the complexity of the attack is low, no privileges are required to exploit it, and no user interaction is needed. The primary impact is on the availability of the affected system, with no direct impact on confidentiality or integrity.

Cisco, the organization behind ClamAV, has acknowledged the issue and released software updates to address the vulnerability. There are no known workarounds that could mitigate this vulnerability, emphasizing the importance of applying the available patches to prevent potential attacks.

For further details on this vulnerability and the associated fixes, refer to the official advisories from Cisco

#ClamAV #CVE202420290 #cisco

A vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-20290 was identified in the OLE2 file format parser of ClamAV, a widely used open-source antivirus engine. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to trigger a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. The core issue arises from an incorrect check for end-of-string values during the scanning process, leading to a potential heap buffer over-read. An attacker can exploit this flaw by sending a specially crafted file containing OLE2 content to be scanned by ClamAV on the targeted device. Successful exploitation would cause the ClamAV scanning process to terminate unexpectedly, resulting in a DoS condition that consumes available system resources.

The vulnerability has been given a CVSS v3 base score of 7.5, indicating a high severity level. The scoring reflects the following characteristics: the attack vector is network-based, the complexity of the attack is low, no privileges are required to exploit it, and no user interaction is needed. The primary impact is on the availability of the affected system, with no direct impact on confidentiality or integrity.

Cisco, the organization behind ClamAV, has acknowledged the issue and released software updates to address the vulnerability. There are no known workarounds that could mitigate this vulnerability, emphasizing the importance of applying the available patches to prevent potential attacks.

For further details on this vulnerability and the associated fixes, refer to the official advisories from Cisco

😈​ ClamAV 1.3.0 feature release and 1.2.2, 1.0.5 security patch release! 😈​

A vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-20290 was identified in the OLE2 file format parser of ClamAV, a widely used open-source antivirus engine. This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to trigger a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. The core issue arises from an incorrect check for end-of-string values during the scanning process, leading to a potential heap buffer over-read. An attacker can exploit this flaw by sending a specially crafted file containing OLE2 content to be scanned by ClamAV on the targeted device. Successful exploitation would cause the ClamAV scanning process to terminate unexpectedly, resulting in a DoS condition that consumes available system resources.

The vulnerability has been given a CVSS v3 base score of 7.5, indicating a high severity level. The scoring reflects the following characteristics: the attack vector is network-based, the complexity of the attack is low, no privileges are required to exploit it, and no user interaction is needed. The primary impact is on the availability of the affected system, with no direct impact on confidentiality or integrity.

Cisco, the organization behind ClamAV, has acknowledged the issue and released software updates to address the vulnerability. There are no known workarounds that could mitigate this vulnerability, emphasizing the importance of applying the available patches to prevent potential attacks.

For further details on this vulnerability and the associated fixes, refer to the official advisories from Cisco

##
simontsui at 2024-02-07T16:12:18.882Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • ClamAV OLE2 File Format Parsing Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20290 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco Expressway Series Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20252, CVE-2024-20254, CVE-2024-20255 (9.6 critical)
    • Note: Cisco's own URL in advisory is missing 'csrf' which is a broken link. Please use https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-expressway-csrf-KnnZDMj3

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory #ClamAV #CiscoExpressway

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-07T16:12:18.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • ClamAV OLE2 File Format Parsing Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20290 (7.5 high)
  • Cisco Expressway Series Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20252, CVE-2024-20254, CVE-2024-20255 (9.6 critical)
    • Note: Cisco's own URL in advisory is missing 'csrf' which is a broken link. Please use https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-expressway-csrf-KnnZDMj3

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory #ClamAV #CiscoExpressway

##

CVE-2024-20252
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Expressway Series and Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks that perform arbitrary actions on an affected device. Note: "Cisco Expressway Series" refers to Cisco Expressway Control (Expressway-C) devices and Cisco Expressway Edge (Expressway-E) dev

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-08T08:59:29.905Z ##

"🚨 Cisco Expressway Gateways under CSRF Attack Siege! 🚨"

Cisco has addressed severe vulnerabilities in its Expressway Series, notably two critical CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) flaws, CVE-2024-20252 and CVE-2024-20254. These vulnerabilities could let unauthenticated attackers remotely trick authenticated users into executing unintended actions by clicking malicious links or visiting attacker-controlled resources, like adding user accounts or gaining administrative privileges. A third bug, CVE-2024-20255 can potentially trigger configuration alterations and denial of service attacks. The company won't provide security updates for the Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) gateway due to reaching the end-of-support date on December 31, 2023, but for other devices still in support, Cisco advises users to upgrade to a fixed version for enhanced security. No active exploit attempts have been reported yet.

Credits: Cisco Security Advisory & BleepingComputer's article

Tags: #Cisco #Cybersecurity #CSRFVulnerability #InfoSec #NetworkSecurity #CSRF #CVE202420252 #CVE202420254 #CVE202420255

The company won't provide security updates for the Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) gateway due to reaching the end-of-support date on December 31, 2023, but for other devices still in support, Cisco advises users to upgrade to a fixed version for enhanced security. No active exploit attempts have been reported yet.

##

CVE-2024-20255
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

A vulnerability in the SOAP API of Cisco Expressway Series and Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to insufficient CSRF protections for the web-based management interface of an affected system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerabilit

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-08T08:59:29.905Z ##

"🚨 Cisco Expressway Gateways under CSRF Attack Siege! 🚨"

Cisco has addressed severe vulnerabilities in its Expressway Series, notably two critical CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) flaws, CVE-2024-20252 and CVE-2024-20254. These vulnerabilities could let unauthenticated attackers remotely trick authenticated users into executing unintended actions by clicking malicious links or visiting attacker-controlled resources, like adding user accounts or gaining administrative privileges. A third bug, CVE-2024-20255 can potentially trigger configuration alterations and denial of service attacks. The company won't provide security updates for the Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS) gateway due to reaching the end-of-support date on December 31, 2023, but for other devices still in support, Cisco advises users to upgrade to a fixed version for enhanced security. No active exploit attempts have been reported yet.

Credits: Cisco Security Advisory & BleepingComputer's article

CVE-2024-1208
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

The LearnDash LMS plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 4.10.2 via API. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to obtain access to quiz questions.

1 repos

https://github.com/karlemilnikka/CVE-2024-1208-and-CVE-2024-1210

karlemilnikka@social.nikkasystems.com at 2024-02-05T18:05:09.000Z ##

Now I can tell you what ruined my Christmas day last year. If you’re running LearnDash LMS, make sure you’ve updated to version 4.10.3.

##

CVE-2024-22433
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

Dell Data Protection Search 19.2.0 and above contain an exposed password opportunity in plain text when using LdapSettings.get_ldap_info in DP Search. A remote unauthorized unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability leading to a loss of Confidentiality, Integrity, Protection, and remote takeover of the system. This is a high-severity vulnerability as it allows an attack

H3liumb0y at 2024-02-06T09:17:39.318Z ##

"🚨 Critical Dell Data Protection Vulnerability Alert! CVE-2024-22433 Exposes Passwords 🚨"

Dell's Data Protection Search version 19.2.0 and later has been identified with a HIGH vulnerability (CVE-2024-22433) that exposes LDAP passwords in plain text. This flaw, due to insecure handling in LdapSettings.get_ldap_info, could let remote attackers without authentication compromise confidentiality, integrity, and take over systems. Immediate patching is advised to safeguard against potential unauthorized access and system control.

🔍 Technical Summary:

  • Attack Vector: Remote
  • Complexity: Low
  • Privileges: None
  • User Interaction: Required
  • Confidentiality Impact: Low
  • Integrity Impact: High
  • Availability Impact: Low
  • Scope: Changed

💡 Mitigation: Dell has issued updates to rectify this vulnerability. Users should update to the latest version promptly to prevent exploitation.

Tags: #CyberSecurity #Dell #Vulnerability #CVE2024_22433 #DataProtection #PatchNow #InfoSec

Source: Dell Security Advisory

🔗 MITRE CVE-2024-22433 for a comprehensive vulnerability profile and mitigation strategies.

Stay updated and secure your systems against this significant threat! 🛡️💻 #StaySafeOnline

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T09:17:39.000Z ##

"🚨 Critical Dell Data Protection Vulnerability Alert! CVE-2024-22433 Exposes Passwords 🚨"

Dell's Data Protection Search version 19.2.0 and later has been identified with a HIGH vulnerability (CVE-2024-22433) that exposes LDAP passwords in plain text. This flaw, due to insecure handling in LdapSettings.get_ldap_info, could let remote attackers without authentication compromise confidentiality, integrity, and take over systems. Immediate patching is advised to safeguard against potential unauthorized access and system control.

🔍 Technical Summary:

  • Attack Vector: Remote
  • Complexity: Low
  • Privileges: None
  • User Interaction: Required
  • Confidentiality Impact: Low
  • Integrity Impact: High
  • Availability Impact: Low
  • Scope: Changed

"🚨 Critical Dell Data Protection Vulnerability Alert! CVE-2024-22433 Exposes Passwords 🚨"

Dell's Data Protection Search version 19.2.0 and later has been identified with a HIGH vulnerability (CVE-2024-22433) that exposes LDAP passwords in plain text. This flaw, due to insecure handling in LdapSettings.get_ldap_info, could let remote attackers without authentication compromise confidentiality, integrity, and take over systems. Immediate patching is advised to safeguard against potential unauthorized access and system control.

🔍 Technical Summary:

  • Attack Vector: Remote
  • Complexity: Low
  • Privileges: None
  • User Interaction: Required
  • Confidentiality Impact: Low
  • Integrity Impact: High
  • Availability Impact: Low
  • Scope: Changed

##

CVE-2024-21893
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

65 posts

A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication.

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-21893-to-CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/h4x0r-dz/CVE-2024-21893.py

simontsui at 2024-02-03T16:09:27.490Z ##

Proof of Concept for CVE-2024-21893 already available for exploiting server side request forgery (SSRF) in Ivanti Connect Secure.
🔗 https://github.com/h4x0r-dz/CVE-2024-21893.py

#Poc #CVE_2024_21893 #Ivanti #connectsecure #eitw #zeroday #activeexploitation #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
simontsui at 2024-02-03T15:58:09.354Z ##

AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis of the Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Ivanti Connect Secure/Ivanti Policy Secure products tracked as CVE-2024-21893. Their twitter post sounded like a new SSRF which had me worried.
🔗 https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-round-two

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA
#CVE_2024_21893

##
catc0n at 2024-02-02T20:25:18.842Z ##

Rapid7 has a full analysis of the #Ivanti #CVE_2024_21893 exploit chain here courtesy of @stephenfewer. Interestingly, it looks like this may actually be n-day from last year: https://attackerkb.com/topics/FGlK1TVnB2/cve-2024-21893/rapid7-analysis

##
StaceyHolleran at 2024-02-02T20:04:10.374Z ##

Rapid7 has published its AttackerKB analysis for #CVE_2024_21893 an SSRF vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure, that has recently been exploited in the wild, allowing attackers bypass the mitigation for an earlier exploit chain. https://attackerkb.com/topics/FGlK1TVnB2/cve-2024-21893

##
decio at 2024-02-02T19:56:28.816Z ##

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:32:38.427Z ##

Ivanti updated their knowledge base article with an available patch:

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.942Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.622Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-03T15:58:09.000Z ##

AssetNote provides a vulnerability analysis of the Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Ivanti Connect Secure/Ivanti Policy Secure products tracked as CVE-2024-21893. Their twitter post sounded like a new SSRF which had me worried.
🔗 https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/ivantis-pulse-connect-secure-auth-bypass-round-two

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA
#CVE_2024_21893

##
StaceyHolleran@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T20:04:10.000Z ##

Rapid7 has published its AttackerKB analysis for #CVE_2024_21893 an SSRF vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure, that has recently been exploited in the wild, allowing attackers bypass the mitigation for an earlier exploit chain. https://attackerkb.com/topics/FGlK1TVnB2/cve-2024-21893

decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T19:56:28.000Z ##

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T15:35:27.000Z ##

watchTowr reports additional zero-days uncovered on a fully patched Ivanti appliance. No further information due to 90 day vulnerability disclosure policy.
🔗 https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472 (just in case someone wants to view it for themselves)

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:32:38.000Z ##

Ivanti updated their knowledge base article with an available patch:

Update 1 February: A patch addressing all known vulnerabilities is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure version 22.5R2.2 and Ivanti Policy Secure 22.5R1.1.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T16:17:03.000Z ##

CISA released supplemental directions for Emergency Directive 24-01 Mitigate Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Vulnerabilities. This assumes anyone running Ivanti Connect Secure or Ivanti Policy Secure solutions have been compromised and the remediation steps include isolating the device from resources, continue threat hunting, performing a factory reset, applying the patch, etc.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/ed-24-01-mitigate-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-vulnerabilities#SupplementalDirectionV1

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #EmergencyDirective

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T01:13:29.000Z ##

CISA added yet another vulnerability to the KEV Catalog on the same day. (I get the feeling that they don't like doing that): CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high) Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and Neurons Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/31/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog-0

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T15:00:14.000Z ##

Hot off the press! Mandiant released additional information about post-exploitation activity by the suspected Chinese state-sponsored threat actor UNC5221 (tracked by Volexity as UTA0178) and provided IOC.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-02-08T21:44:52.000Z ##

Oh man, Ivanti is going for the full list of attack vectors, huh?

First we got the auth-bypass (CVE-2023-46805) and the command-injection (CVE-2024-21887), then we added privilege-escalation (CVE-2024-21888) and an SSRF (CVE-2024-21893), and today we get CVE-2024-22024, an XXE vulnerability in their SAML that provides unauth'd access to some components.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

-Philippines says Chinese hackers tried to brute-force its govt Google Workspace
-Google tracks ~40 spyware vendors
-Reports on ResumeLooters, RedCurl gangs
-Malware reports on BlackHunt, Ov3r_Stealer, Mispadu Stealer, PikaBot
-Android and Canon security updates
-2023 CISA KEV entries were mostly insecure exposed function vulnerabilities... not memory corruption
-Ivanti zero-day CVE-2024-21893 enter mass exploitation
-New tool—Root User Alarm

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-02-07T11:05:05.000Z ##

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-02-05T16:20:25.000Z ##

Newest Ivanti SSRF zero-day now under mass exploitation

An Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-21893 is currently under...
