##
avolha at 2024-02-02T21:18:25.856Z ##

Parę słów o tym, dlaczego CISA dała amerykańskim agencjom federalnym tylko 48 godz. na uporanie się z lukami w VPN-ach firmy Ivanti. Otóż luki pozwalające przejąć nad nimi kontrolę dodała do swego arsenału wspierana przez chiński rząd grupa APT, którą Volexity identyfikuje jako UTA0178, a Mandiant jako UNC5221.

Ataki zaczęły się na początku grudnia i przybrały charakter globalny (przejęte urządzenia znajdują się też w Polsce, choć w porównaniu z USA niewiele). W styczniu badacze przeanalizowali wykorzystanie CVE-2023-46805 i CVE-2024-21887. Pierwsza z wymienionych luk pozwala na ominięcie uwierzytelniania. Druga umożliwia wstrzyknięcie dowolnego polecenia w panelu webowym takich urządzeń, jak Ivanti Connect Secure i Ivanti Policy Secure. Atakujący posłużyli się nimi, by wykraść dane, za pomocą których logowali się później do wewnętrznych systemów przez RDP/SMB/SSH.

Ledwo Ivanti wydało stosowne poprawki, wykryto jeszcze dwie luki. CVE-2024-21888 umożliwia podniesienie poziomu uprawnień, a CVE-2024-21893 jest błędem po stronie serwera, który daje dostęp do określonych zasobów bez uwierzytelniania. Drugą z wymienionych luk zainteresowali się już przestępcy.

Analizy Volexity:
1. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/10/active-exploitation-of-two-zero-day-vulnerabilities-in-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn/
2. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/
3. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-new-observations/
4. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/02/01/how-memory-forensics-revealed-exploitation-of-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day-vulnerabilities/

Analizy Mandianta:
1. https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day
2. https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #ivanti

##
KyanHexagon at 2024-02-02T20:16:49.675Z ##

https://attackerkb.com/topics/FGlK1TVnB2/cve-2024-21893/rapid7-analysis

CVE-2024-21893 AttackerKB Analysis- Complete technical analysis, including exploitation walkthrough, for the newly disclosed CVE-2024-21893, an SSRF vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure, that has recently been exploited in the wild, allowing attackers bypass the mitigation for an earlier exploit chain.

#ivanti

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T17:37:38.440Z ##

@wdormann watchTowr reports additional zero-days discovered while trying to reproduce the Ivanti CVEs CVE-2024-21888 and CVE-2024-21893:
https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.714Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
h4sh at 2024-02-01T02:20:40.683Z ##

Yet another Ivanti bug.. CVE-2024-21893 SSRF allows unauthenticated access to sensitive resources (CVSS 8.2), added to KEV.

Patch is available to some but not all versions (available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3). The "staggered" release schedule applies for other versions

Ivanti is really on a roll here
#cve
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21893

simontsui at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.148Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T13:25:43.480Z ##

@da_667

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator. "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x), Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"
##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

##
avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T21:18:25.000Z ##

Parę słów o tym, dlaczego CISA dała amerykańskim agencjom federalnym tylko 48 godz. na uporanie się z lukami w VPN-ach firmy Ivanti. Otóż luki pozwalające przejąć nad nimi kontrolę dodała do swego arsenału wspierana przez chiński rząd grupa APT, którą Volexity identyfikuje jako UTA0178, a Mandiant jako UNC5221.

Ataki zaczęły się na początku grudnia i przybrały charakter globalny (przejęte urządzenia znajdują się też w Polsce, choć w porównaniu z USA niewiele). W styczniu badacze przeanalizowali wykorzystanie CVE-2023-46805 i CVE-2024-21887. Pierwsza z wymienionych luk pozwala na ominięcie uwierzytelniania. Druga umożliwia wstrzyknięcie dowolnego polecenia w panelu webowym takich urządzeń, jak Ivanti Connect Secure i Ivanti Policy Secure. Atakujący posłużyli się nimi, by wykraść dane, za pomocą których logowali się później do wewnętrznych systemów przez RDP/SMB/SSH.

Ledwo Ivanti wydało stosowne poprawki, wykryto jeszcze dwie luki. CVE-2024-21888 umożliwia podniesienie poziomu uprawnień, a CVE-2024-21893 jest błędem po stronie serwera, który daje dostęp do określonych zasobów bez uwierzytelniania. Drugą z wymienionych luk zainteresowali się już przestępcy.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.000Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.000Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
" CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch." https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T13:25:43.000Z ##

@da_667

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"
##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

##

CVE-2024-22024
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

20 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-02-08T20:42:40.377Z ##

Ivanti updated their security advisory today 08 February 2024 with the following information:

  • A patch is available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.5, 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4, 22.4R2.3, 22.5R1.2, 22.5R2.3 and 22.6R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4 and 22.5R1.2) and ZTA gateways (versions 22.5R1.6, 22.6R1.5 and 22.6R1.7).
  • As part of our ongoing investigation, we have discovered a new vulnerability. We are reporting this vulnerability as CVE-2024-22024 which allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. We have a patch available now for the affected versions and additional versions which fix all previously disclosed vulnerabilities.This vulnerability only affects a limited number of supported versions – Ivanti Connect Secure (version 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.We have no evidence of any customers being exploited by CVE-2024-22024.We are reporting these vulnerabilities in this knowledge base article as it is resolved in the patch detailed below. For supported versions where a patch has not been released, the mitigation provided on 31 January is effective at blocking this vulnerable endpoint and the patch and mitigation are available now via the standard download portal.

🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#CVE_2024_22024 #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability

##
simontsui at 2024-02-08T20:35:37.701Z ##

Ivanti has a blog update and security advisory for a newly discovered Ivanti Connect Secure XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability CVE-2024-22024 (8.3 high). "We have no evidence of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild"
🔗 Blog: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways-282024
Advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

"Ivanti: Patch new Connect Secure auth bypass bug immediately"
👇​
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ivanti-patch-new-connect-secure-auth-bypass-bug-immediately/

"CVE-2024-22024 only applies to a limited number of versions. However, all customers using Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure should promptly apply the patch for their supported version, when available, regardless of whether they installed prior patches from 31 January and 1 February, as the patch resolves all previously disclosed vulnerabilities. ##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T20:42:40.000Z ##

Ivanti updated their security advisory today 08 February 2024 with the following information:

  • A patch is available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.5, 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4, 22.4R2.3, 22.5R1.2, 22.5R2.3 and 22.6R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4 and 22.5R1.2) and ZTA gateways (versions 22.5R1.6, 22.6R1.5 and 22.6R1.7).
  • As part of our ongoing investigation, we have discovered a new vulnerability. We are reporting this vulnerability as CVE-2024-22024 which allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. We have a patch available now for the affected versions and additional versions which fix all previously disclosed vulnerabilities.This vulnerability only affects a limited number of supported versions – Ivanti Connect Secure (version 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.We have no evidence of any customers being exploited by CVE-2024-22024.We are reporting these vulnerabilities in this knowledge base article as it is resolved in the patch detailed below. For supported versions where a patch has not been released, the mitigation provided on 31 January is effective at blocking this vulnerable endpoint and the patch and mitigation are available now via the standard download portal.

🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#CVE_2024_22024 #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability

##
simontsui at 2024-02-08T20:42:40.377Z ##

Ivanti updated their security advisory today 08 February 2024 with the following information:

  • A patch is available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.5, 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4, 22.4R2.3, 22.5R1.2, 22.5R2.3 and 22.6R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4 and 22.5R1.2) and ZTA gateways (versions 22.5R1.6, 22.6R1.5 and 22.6R1.7).
  • As part of our ongoing investigation, we have discovered a new vulnerability. We are reporting this vulnerability as CVE-2024-22024 which allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. We have a patch available now for the affected versions and additional versions which fix all previously disclosed vulnerabilities.This vulnerability only affects a limited number of supported versions – Ivanti Connect Secure (version 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.We have no evidence of any customers being exploited by CVE-2024-22024.We are reporting these vulnerabilities in this knowledge base article as it is resolved in the patch detailed below. For supported versions where a patch has not been released, the mitigation provided on 31 January is effective at blocking this vulnerable endpoint and the patch and mitigation are available now via the standard download portal.

🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#CVE_2024_22024 #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T20:42:40.000Z ##

Ivanti updated their security advisory today 08 February 2024 with the following information:

  • A patch is available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.5, 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4, 22.4R2.3, 22.5R1.2, 22.5R2.3 and 22.6R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure (versions 9.1R17.3, 9.1R18.4 and 22.5R1.2) and ZTA gateways (versions 22.5R1.6, 22.6R1.5 and 22.6R1.7).
  • As part of our ongoing investigation, we have discovered a new vulnerability. We are reporting this vulnerability as CVE-2024-22024 which allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. We have a patch available now for the affected versions and additional versions which fix all previously disclosed vulnerabilities.This vulnerability only affects a limited number of supported versions – Ivanti Connect Secure (version 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.We have no evidence of any customers being exploited by CVE-2024-22024.We are reporting these vulnerabilities in this knowledge base article as it is resolved in the patch detailed below. For supported versions where a patch has not been released, the mitigation provided on 31 January is effective at blocking this vulnerable endpoint and the patch and mitigation are available now via the standard download portal.

🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

#CVE_2024_22024 #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability

##
dangoodin at 2024-02-09T01:37:11.335Z ##

People securing Ivanti Connect Secure products: It's time to patch a NEW vulnerability. There's no indication that CVE-2024-22024 is being actively exploited, but given events of the past month, it'd be prudent to believe it could be soon.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-02-08T21:44:52.000Z ##

Oh man, Ivanti is going for the full list of attack vectors, huh?

First we got the auth-bypass (CVE-2023-46805) and the command-injection (CVE-2024-21887), then we added privilege-escalation (CVE-2024-21888) and an SSRF (CVE-2024-21893), and today we get CVE-2024-22024, an XXE vulnerability in their SAML that provides unauth'd access to some components.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
dangoodin@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-09T01:37:11.000Z ##

People securing Ivanti Connect Secure products: It's time to patch a NEW vulnerability. There's no indication that CVE-2024-22024 is being actively exploited, but given events of the past month, it'd be prudent to believe it could be soon.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-02-08T21:44:52.000Z ##

Oh man, Ivanti is going for the full list of attack vectors, huh?

First we got the auth-bypass (CVE-2023-46805) and the command-injection (CVE-2024-21887), then we added privilege-escalation (CVE-2024-21888) and an SSRF (CVE-2024-21893), and today we get CVE-2024-22024, an XXE vulnerability in their SAML that provides unauth'd access to some components.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

CVE-2024-21762
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-02-09T01:41:00.442Z ##

New Fortinet zero-day:
CVE-2024-21762 (9.6 critical) FortiOS - Out-of-bound Write in sslvpnd: A out-of-bounds write vulnerability [CWE-787] in FortiOS may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code or command via specially crafted HTTP requests.

Note: This is potentially being exploited in the wild.

🔗 https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-015

#Fortinet #FortiOS #zeroday #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_21762

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-09T01:41:00.000Z ##

Note: This is potentially being exploited in the wild.

🔗 https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-24-015

##

CVE-2024-23108
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

9 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

simontsui at 2024-02-08T03:29:22.429Z ##

Fortinet lied after hiding vulnerabilities in an old advisory: @hacks_zach of Horizon3 posted a screenshot of his email with Fortinet PSIRT showing that he submitted CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109. These are patch bypass vulnerabilities of CVE-2023-34992, according to a new and updated Bleeping Computer article.
🔗 Zach Hanley tweet: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695/photo/1
Bleeping Computer article: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM #CVE_2023_34992

##
simontsui at 2024-02-06T21:05:45.758Z ##

Wake up sheeple: Fortinet just tried to hide two maximum severity vulnerabilities in an older security advisory:

  • CVE-2024-23108 (10.0 critical)
  • CVE-2024-23109 (10.0 critical)

Both have the same description: "An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests."
🔗(10 October 2023) https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130

EDIT 07 February 2024: According to Bleeping Computer, these are legitimate vulnerabilities once again: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM

##
KyanHexagon at 2024-02-06T14:18:44.157Z ##

https://www.theregister.com/2024/02/06/fortinet_fortisiem_vulns/

Fortinet's FortiSIEM product is vulnerable to two new maximum-severity security vulnerabilities that allow for remote code execution.

#fortinet #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T03:29:22.000Z ##

Fortinet lied after hiding vulnerabilities in an old advisory: @hacks_zach of Horizon3 posted a screenshot of his email with Fortinet PSIRT showing that he submitted CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109. These are patch bypass vulnerabilities of CVE-2023-34992, according to a new and updated Bleeping Computer article.
🔗 Zach Hanley tweet: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695/photo/1
Bleeping Computer article: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T21:05:45.000Z ##

Wake up sheeple: Fortinet just tried to hide two maximum severity vulnerabilities in an older security advisory:

  • CVE-2024-23108 (10.0 critical)
  • CVE-2024-23109 (10.0 critical)

Both have the same description: "An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests."
🔗(10 October 2023) https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130

EDIT 07 February 2024: According to Bleeping Computer, these are legitimate vulnerabilities once again: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM

##
KyanHexagon@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T14:18:44.000Z ##

https://www.theregister.com/2024/02/06/fortinet_fortisiem_vulns/

Fortinet's FortiSIEM product is vulnerable to two new maximum-severity security vulnerabilities that allow for remote code execution.

#fortinet #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109

##
jbhall56 at 2024-02-08T13:30:57.489Z ##

Fortinet added the two new vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to the original advisory for the CVE-2023-34992 flaw in a very confusing update. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-02-07T13:40:06.000Z ##

Fortinet snafu: Critical FortiSIEM CVEs are duplicates, issued in error

It turns out that critical Fortinet FortiSIEM vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are not new and have been published this...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/0skssf

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T13:30:57.000Z ##

Fortinet added the two new vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to the original advisory for the CVE-2023-34992 flaw in a very confusing update. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

##

CVE-2024-23109
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

9 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

simontsui at 2024-02-08T03:29:22.429Z ##

Fortinet lied after hiding vulnerabilities in an old advisory: @hacks_zach of Horizon3 posted a screenshot of his email with Fortinet PSIRT showing that he submitted CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109. These are patch bypass vulnerabilities of CVE-2023-34992, according to a new and updated Bleeping Computer article.
🔗 Zach Hanley tweet: https://twitter.com/hacks_zach/status/1755309941982646695/photo/1
Bleeping Computer article: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

#Fortinet #securityadvisory #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23108 #CVE_2024_23109 #FortiSIEM #CVE_2023_34992

##
simontsui at 2024-02-06T21:05:45.758Z ##

Wake up sheeple: Fortinet just tried to hide two maximum severity vulnerabilities in an older security advisory:

  • CVE-2024-23108 (10.0 critical)
  • CVE-2024-23109 (10.0 critical)

Both have the same description: "An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests."
🔗(10 October 2023) https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-130

EDIT 07 February 2024: According to Bleeping Computer, these are legitimate vulnerabilities once again: https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T21:05:45.000Z ##

Wake up sheeple: Fortinet just tried to hide two maximum severity vulnerabilities in an older security advisory:

  • CVE-2024-23108 (10.0 critical)
  • CVE-2024-23109 (10.0 critical)

Both have the same description: "An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests."

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-08T13:30:57.000Z ##

Fortinet added the two new vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 to the original advisory for the CVE-2023-34992 flaw in a very confusing update. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/fortinet-warns-of-new-fortisiem-rce-bugs-in-confusing-disclosure/

##

CVE-2024-21888
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

18 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator.

jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-02-08T21:44:52.000Z ##

Oh man, Ivanti is going for the full list of attack vectors, huh?

First we got the auth-bypass (CVE-2023-46805) and the command-injection (CVE-2024-21887), then we added privilege-escalation (CVE-2024-21888) and an SSRF (CVE-2024-21893), and today we get CVE-2024-22024, an XXE vulnerability in their SAML that provides unauth'd access to some components.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-22024-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

##
simontsui at 2024-02-05T15:10:37.422Z ##

@wdormann I have to disagree here. Ivanti created a new advisory (originally created 22 January for logged in Ivanti customers, and made public on 31 January) https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US , and updated both the blog https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways and the older advisory from 10 January https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US which everyone was following for updates.

##
avolha at 2024-02-02T21:18:25.856Z ##

Parę słów o tym, dlaczego CISA dała amerykańskim agencjom federalnym tylko 48 godz. na uporanie się z lukami w VPN-ach firmy Ivanti. Otóż luki pozwalające przejąć nad nimi kontrolę dodała do swego arsenału wspierana przez chiński rząd grupa APT, którą Volexity identyfikuje jako UTA0178, a Mandiant jako UNC5221.

Ataki zaczęły się na początku grudnia i przybrały charakter globalny (przejęte urządzenia znajdują się też w Polsce, choć w porównaniu z USA niewiele). W styczniu badacze przeanalizowali wykorzystanie CVE-2023-46805 i CVE-2024-21887. Pierwsza z wymienionych luk pozwala na ominięcie uwierzytelniania. Druga umożliwia wstrzyknięcie dowolnego polecenia w panelu webowym takich urządzeń, jak Ivanti Connect Secure i Ivanti Policy Secure. Atakujący posłużyli się nimi, by wykraść dane, za pomocą których logowali się później do wewnętrznych systemów przez RDP/SMB/SSH.

Ledwo Ivanti wydało stosowne poprawki, wykryto jeszcze dwie luki. CVE-2024-21888 umożliwia podniesienie poziomu uprawnień, a CVE-2024-21893 jest błędem po stronie serwera, który daje dostęp do określonych zasobów bez uwierzytelniania. Drugą z wymienionych luk zainteresowali się już przestępcy.

Analizy Volexity:
1. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/10/active-exploitation-of-two-zero-day-vulnerabilities-in-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn/
2. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/
3. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-new-observations/
4. https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/02/01/how-memory-forensics-revealed-exploitation-of-ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-zero-day-vulnerabilities/

Analizy Mandianta:
1. https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-day
2. https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-zero-day-exploitation

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #ivanti

##
simontsui at 2024-02-02T17:37:38.440Z ##

@wdormann watchTowr reports additional zero-days discovered while trying to reproduce the Ivanti CVEs CVE-2024-21888 and CVE-2024-21893:
https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber/status/1753366975609475472

##
simontsui at 2024-02-01T20:22:13.714Z ##

@dangoodin Patch testing takes time to ensure that threat actors don't figure out a way to bypass the patch, which would then be in itself a new zero-day (when someone other than the vendor knows an existing vulnerability). During their continued investigation and patch testing, they discovered CVE-2024-21888, which they stated "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time" and CVE-2024-21893 (We are only aware of a small number of customers who have been impacted by CVE-2024-21893 at this time.)

The patch they released for about 7 versions of products (Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2, 22.5R1.1 and 22.5R2.2), Ivanti Policy Secure version 22.5R1.1 and ZTA version 22.6R1.3) fix all four vulnerabilities instead of hotfixing two and needing additional patches. "CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch."

I can't believe I'm defending Ivanti but rushing a patch would have been worse.

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T14:27:32.148Z ##

@cert_eu It should be noted in this toot that " A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3." https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
" CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, CVE-2024-21888, and CVE-2024-21893 are all remediated with the patch." https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways

##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T13:25:43.480Z ##

@da_667

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator. "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x), Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication. "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"
##
simontsui at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.869Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-01-31T11:44:46.000Z ##

Ivanti identified two new vulnerabilities (one actively exploited) in connection to the Ivanti Connect Secure zero-days from 10 January 2024. They are:

  • CVE-2024-21888 (8.8 high) privilege escalation in web component "We have no evidence of customers being impacted by CVE-2024-21888 at this time"
  • CVE-2024-21893 (8.2 high, exploited in the wild) sever side request forgery (SSRF) in the SAML component "At the time of publication, the exploitation of CVE-2024-21893 appears to be targeted"

A patch is now available for Ivanti Connect Secure (versions 9.1R14.4, 9.1R17.2, 9.1R18.3, 22.4R2.2 and 22.5R1.1) and ZTA version 22.6R1.3.
🔗 https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US
blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways
security advisory: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2024-21888-Privilege-Escalation-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure?language=en_US

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-01-31T11:34:07.000Z ##

More hilarity on #ConnectAround - there’s now two NEW vulnerabilities in Ivanti Pulse Secure, being actively exploited as zero days too - no patches for many versions.

Updated advisory with updated mitigations you need to reapply:
https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

CVEs: CVE-2024-21893 and CVE-2024-21888

CERT advisory: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Cybersicherheitswarnungen/DE/2024/2024-205101-1032.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=2

Ivanti recommend you factory reset your devices in their advisory.

HT @fthy

#threatintel

##

CVE-2023-6246
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

33 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when the openlog function was not called, or called with the ident argument set to NULL, and the program name (the basename of argv[0]) is bigger than 1024 bytes, resulting in an application crash or local privilege escalatio

dalias@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-07T20:02:47.000Z ##

FWIW, @alpinelinux is not affected by CVE-2023-6246. 😁 🦪

##
petrillic@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-03T21:59:11.000Z ##

:chefs kiss: https://xeiaso.net//shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

##
alcinnz@floss.social at 2024-02-02T20:48:14.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens - Xe: https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

I do sympathize with the struggle to retrofit these type checks into such a well-established language, but...

##
blp@framapiaf.org at 2024-02-02T18:21:48.000Z ##

This made me laugh: https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

##
ajn142 at 2024-02-02T18:11:08.371Z ##

@dave_aitel @briankrebs

I do like the point of all the problems patching doesn’t solve. To do the bad thing and borrow military terminology into infosec, I think attack surface reduction is particularly applicable at the strategic level. This is something a CISO should be steering the organization as a whole towards. Patching and inventory are more akin to a tactical level, they’re basics and table stakes that need to be done to be effective, and can hurt significantly if done poorly but don’t help much if done right. Using an example from the article, anything you pick to run your mail server and webmail on besides MS Exchange very likely leverages glibc, and was potentially impacted by CVE-2023-6246. If you don’t patch things like that then congrats, you just undid the strategic efforts at ASR, but if you do patch it that and 2 bucks will buy you a Coke.

##
hnbot@chrispelli.fun at 2024-02-01T20:50:24.000Z ##

"No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens - https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2023-6246/

#hackernews

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2024-02-01T13:39:01.000Z ##

New #Linux #glibc flaw lets attackers get root on major distros
Qualys confirmed that #Debian 12 and 13, #Ubuntu 23.04 and 23.10, and #Fedora 37 to 39 were all vulnerable to CVE-2023-6246 exploits, allowing any unprivileged user to escalate privileges to full root access on default installations.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-linux-glibc-flaw-lets-attackers-get-root-on-major-distros/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-02-01T13:00:47.798Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-6246 and described as a heap-based buffer overflow, the issue was identified in glibc’s __vsyslog_internal() function, which is called by the widely-used syslog() and vsyslog() logging functions. https://www.securityweek.com/gnu-c-library-vulnerability-leads-to-full-root-access/

##
malwarelab_eu at 2024-02-01T06:56:16.174Z ##

Recent privilege escalation vulnerabilities in GNU C Library #glibc widely used in many #Linux distributions such as #Debian, #Ubuntu, #Fedora and others.

CVE-2023-6246 #privesc #vuln can be triggered via #syslog by using long program name or ident parameter in openlog().

Another vulnerability is in #qsort function. While real-world affected programs are currently not known, this vulnerability is pretty old - since 1992 until now.

Reference: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/01/30/qualys-tru-discovers-important-vulnerabilities-in-gnu-c-librarys-syslog

This is just another reason to consider using Linux distribution without glibc, for example #Alpine Linux with #musl

##
raptor at 2024-02-01T06:22:02.337Z ##

CVE-2023-6246: Heap-based buffer #overflow in the #glibc's syslog()

* another awesome advisory by @qualys

* love the reference to @solardiz’s exploit from 1997 and the link to insecure.org exploit db (blast from the past!)

* snprintf() return value behavior is a common source of bugs (https://github.com/0xdea/semgrep-rules/blob/main/c/unsafe-ret-snprintf-vsnprintf.yaml)

* in awe of the exploit development strategy 🤩

https://www.qualys.com/2024/01/30/cve-2023-6246/syslog.txt

##
Ichinin at 2024-01-31T19:11:34.008Z ##

@dangoodin Elevation of Privileges - looks like it. According to cve.org, it seems like it can either crash or cause a local privilege elevation:
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-6246

In the Qualys paper ( https://www.qualys.com/2024/01/30/cve-2023-6246/syslog.txt ) they say that the heap overflow can be made better and i wouldn't be surprised if someone produced a more stable exploit for this in a few hours:

"Note: this exploit could certainly be made much more efficient; in
theory, it could even be a one-shot exploit, because we do not need to brute force the ASLR, only the heap layout."

##
dangoodin at 2024-01-31T17:50:39.985Z ##

Trying to figure out what to think about the glibc vulnerabilities affecting most Linux platforms. Is CVE-2023-6246 a big deal? It appears to be only an EoP vulnerability, but it also seems to be the case that it provides a direct path to getting root. Have any of y'all looked into this and have thoughts?

https://www.qualys.com/2024/01/30/cve-2023-6246/syslog.txt

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/01/30/qualys-tru-discovers-important-vulnerabilities-in-gnu-c-librarys-syslog

##
jbhall56 at 2024-01-31T14:03:02.744Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2023-6246, this security flaw was found in glibc's __vsyslog_internal() function, called by the widely-used syslog and vsyslog functions for writing messages to the system message logger. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-linux-glibc-flaw-lets-attackers-get-root-on-major-distros

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T11:20:04.000Z ##

PoC pubblico per lo sfruttamento della CVE-2023-6246 relativa a glibc (AL02/240131/CSIRT-ITA)

🔗️ [Csirt] https://link.is.it/kpuhe7

##
b9AcE@todon.eu at 2024-01-31T10:02:44.000Z ##

'New Linux glibc flaw lets [local] attackers get root on major distros
[...]
While testing their findings, Qualys confirmed that Debian 12 and 13, Ubuntu 23.04 and 23.10, and Fedora 37 to 39 were all vulnerable to CVE-2023-6246 exploits, allowing any unprivileged user to escalate privileges to full root access on default installations.

Although their tests were limited to a handful of distros, the researchers added that "other distributions are probably also exploitable."'
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-linux-glibc-flaw-lets-attackers-get-root-on-major-distros/

"The vulnerability found in qsort() has affected all glibc versions released since 1992."
https://thehackernews.com/2024/01/new-glibc-flaw-grants-attackers-root.html

##
jvoisin at 2024-01-31T01:06:11.388Z ##

Musings on CVE-2023-6246 on hardened_malloc — https://dustri.org/b/musings-on-cve-2023-6246-on-hardened_malloc.html

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-01-30T19:12:06.000Z ##

Qualys just published two vulnerabilities in #glibc

- an out-of-bounds read/write in qsort dating back to glibc 1.04 (1992): https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/7
- CVE-2023-6246: Heap-based buffer overflow in syslog() in glibc >=2.37 (August 2022): https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/6

The latter allows for a local user privilege escalation to root.

As usual, the Qualys vulnerability write-ups are excellent and provide a detailed walk-through of the code.

##
harrysintonen at 2024-01-30T18:36:03.489Z ##

CVE-2023-6246 - #glibc syslog() heap-based buffer overflow #vulnerability - https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/01/30/6 - Impact: local privilege escalation to root #CVE #infosec

To do the bad thing and borrow military terminology into infosec, I think attack surface reduction is particularly applicable at the strategic level. This is something a CISO should be steering the organization as a whole towards. Patching and inventory are more akin to a tactical level, they’re basics and table stakes that need to be done to be effective, and can hurt significantly if done poorly but don’t help much if done right. Tracked as CVE-2023-6246 and described as a heap-based buffer overflow, the issue was identified in glibc’s __vsyslog_internal() function, which is called by the widely-used syslog() and vsyslog() logging functions. https://www.securityweek.com/gnu-c-library-vulnerability-leads-to-full-root-access/

##
malwarelab_eu@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T06:56:16.000Z ##

Recent privilege escalation vulnerabilities in GNU C Library #glibc widely used in many #Linux distributions such as #Debian, #Ubuntu, #Fedora and others.

CVE-2023-6246 #privesc #vuln can be triggered via #syslog by using long program name or ident parameter in openlog().

Another vulnerability is in #qsort function. While real-world affected programs are currently not known, this vulnerability is pretty old - since 1992 until now.

Reference: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2024/01/30/qualys-tru-discovers-important-vulnerabilities-in-gnu-c-librarys-syslog

This is just another reason to consider using Linux distribution without glibc, for example #Alpine Linux with #musl

##

CVE-2024-23917
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

5 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.3 authentication bypass leading to RCE was possible

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-02-07T11:05:05.000Z ##

On-premises JetBrains TeamCity servers vulnerable to auth bypass (CVE-2024-23917) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/02/07/cve-2024-23917/ #continuousintegration #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #JetBrains #Hotstuff #News

##
simontsui at 2024-02-06T18:16:02.239Z ##

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23917:
Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) exploited a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793 (9.8 critical) worldwide, as reported in a CISA cybersecurity advisory dated 13 December 2023, less than 2 months ago. APT29, aka Cozy Bear is a state-sponsored cyber actor that exploited CVE-2023-42793 at a large scale, targeting servers hosting JetBrains TeamCity software since September 2023.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass #Russia #SVR #APT29 #CozyBear #cyberespionage

##
simontsui at 2024-02-06T17:34:11.979Z ##

Yet another JetBrains TeamCity On-Prem vulnerability: CVE-2024-23917 (9.8 critical)

If abused, the flaw may enable an unauthenticated attacker with HTTP(S) access to a TeamCity server to bypass authentication checks and gain administrative control of that TeamCity server.

🔗 https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/02/critical-security-issue-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-23917/

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T18:16:02.000Z ##

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23917:
Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) exploited a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793 (9.8 critical) worldwide, as reported in a CISA cybersecurity advisory dated 13 December 2023, less than 2 months ago. APT29, aka Cozy Bear is a state-sponsored cyber actor that exploited CVE-2023-42793 at a large scale, targeting servers hosting JetBrains TeamCity software since September 2023.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23917 #authenticationbypass #Russia #SVR #APT29 #CozyBear #cyberespionage

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-06T17:34:11.000Z ##

Yet another JetBrains TeamCity On-Prem vulnerability: CVE-2024-23917 (9.8 critical)

If abused, the flaw may enable an unauthenticated attacker with HTTP(S) access to a TeamCity server to bypass authentication checks and gain administrative control of that TeamCity server.

🔗 https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/02/critical-security-issue-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-23917/

##

CVE-2024-23447
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

An issue was discovered in the Windows Network Drive Connector when using Document Level Security to assign permissions to a file, with explicit allow write and deny read. Although the document is not accessible to the user in Network Drive it is visible in search applications to the user.

simontsui at 2024-02-07T01:49:48.368Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-01)
    CVE-2024-23446 (5.0 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue
  • Elastic Network Drive Connector 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-02)
    CVE-2024-23447 (6.5 medium) Elastic Network Drive Connector Improper Access Control
  • APM Server 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-03)
    CVE-2024-23448 (5.7 medium) APM Server Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #Kibana #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-07T01:49:48.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-23448
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

An issue was discovered whereby APM Server could log at ERROR level, a response from Elasticsearch indicating that indexing the document failed and that response would contain parts of the original document. Depending on the nature of the document that the APM Server attempted to ingest, this could lead to the insertion of sensitive or private information in the APM Server logs.

simontsui at 2024-02-07T01:49:48.368Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-01)
    CVE-2024-23446 (5.0 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue
  • Elastic Network Drive Connector 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-02)
    CVE-2024-23447 (6.5 medium) Elastic Network Drive Connector Improper Access Control
  • APM Server 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-03)
    CVE-2024-23448 (5.7 medium) APM Server Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #Kibana #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2024-23446
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

An issue was discovered by Elastic, whereby the Detection Engine Search API does not respect Document-level security (DLS) or Field-level security (FLS) when querying the .alerts-security.alerts-{space_id} indices. Users who are authorized to call this API may obtain unauthorized access to documents if their roles are configured with DLS or FLS against the aforementioned index.

simontsui at 2024-02-07T01:49:48.368Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-01)
    CVE-2024-23446 (5.0 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue
  • Elastic Network Drive Connector 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-02)
    CVE-2024-23447 (6.5 medium) Elastic Network Drive Connector Improper Access Control
  • APM Server 8.12.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-03)
    CVE-2024-23448 (5.7 medium) APM Server Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #Kibana #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

CVE-2023-47568
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

A SQL injection vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow authenticated users to inject malicious code via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following versions: QTS 5.1.5.2645 build 20240116 and later QTS 4.5.4.2627 build 20231225 and later QuTS hero h5.1.5.2647 build 20240118 and later QuT

avoidthehack at 2024-02-05T16:20:00.627Z ##

#QNAP Patches High-Severity Bugs in QTS, Qsync Central

High severity OS command #injection flaws ( CVE-2023-45025 and CVE-2023-39297) found in some QNAP devices.

Also two remotely exploitable flaws (OS command injections and SQL injection) tracked as CVE-2023-47567 and CVE-2023-47568.

According to QNAP, no evidence these vulnerabilities have been exploited in the wild.

If you have a device, you should update ASAP!

#cybersecurity #cve #security #update

https://www.securityweek.com/qnap-patches-high-severity-bugs-in-qts-qsync-central/

##

CVE-2024-24747
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

### Summary When someone creates an access key, it inherits the permissions of the parent key. Not only for `s3:*` actions, but also `admin:*` actions. Which means unless somewhere above in the access-key hierarchy, the `admin` rights are denied, access keys will be able to simply override their own `s3` permissions to something more permissive. Credit to @xSke for sort of accidentally discove

sublimer@mstdn.sublimer.me at 2024-02-05T08:06:06.000Z ##

OSSのオブジェクトストレージのminioで、リソースの安全ではない値への初期化 (CWE-1188)の脆弱性(CVE-2024-24747)
CVSSスコアは8.8
アクセスキー作成時に、admin:*も含めて親のキーの権限を継承するため、階層のどこかでadminが拒否されていない限り、自身の権限よりも強力な権限に上書きできるとのこと
RELEASE.2024-01-31T20-20-33Zで修正済み

Implicit allow for Access keys to inherit `admin:UpdateServiceAccount` allows for privilege escalation · Advisory · minio/minio : 👀
---
https://github.com/minio/minio/security/advisories/GHSA-xx8w-mq23-29g4

CVE-2024-23651
(8.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

### Impact Two malicious build steps running in parallel sharing the same cache mounts with subpaths could cause a race condition that can lead to files from the host system being accessible to the build container. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing cache mounts with

##

CVE-2024-21626
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

8 posts

### Impact In runc 1.1.11 and earlier, due to an internal file descriptor leak, an attacker could cause a newly-spawned container process (from `runc exec`) to have a working directory in the host filesystem namespace, allowing for a container escape by giving access to the host filesystem ("attack 2"). The same attack could be used by a malicious image to allow a container process to gain access

7 repos

https://github.com/V0WKeep3r/CVE-2024-21626-runcPOC

https://github.com/zpxlz/CVE-2024-21626-POC

https://github.com/NitroCao/CVE-2024-21626

https://github.com/Wall1e/CVE-2024-21626-POC

https://github.com/zhangguanzhang/CVE-2024-21626

jbhall56 at 2024-02-03T15:30:45.736Z ##

The flaws are collectively called Leaky Vessels and they are tracked as CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-23651, CVE-2024-23653 and CVE-2024-23652. https://www.securityweek.com/leaky-vessels-container-escape-vulnerabilities-impact-docker-others/

##
KyanHexagon at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.365Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

##
harrysintonen at 2024-01-31T20:56:28.498Z ##

CVE-2024-21626: runc container breakout #vulnerability through process.cwd trickery and leaked fds - https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/security/advisories/GHSA-xr7r-f8xq-vfvv #infosec #CVE

##
bmitch@fosstodon.org at 2024-01-31T20:21:19.000Z ##

#runc has a security release to fix CVE-2024-21626. It's a container escape using file descriptors, and scored 8.6. So if you run images that you don't fully trust, you'll want to upgrade soon. runc is the underlying runtime of a lot of popular container environments. The fixed release is 1.1.12.

https://github.com/opencontainers/runc/security/advisories/GHSA-xr7r-f8xq-vfvv

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-03T15:30:45.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-23653
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

### Impact In addition to running containers as build steps, BuildKit also provides APIs for running interactive containers based on built images. It was possible to use these APIs to ask BuildKit to run a container with elevated privileges. Normally, running such containers is only allowed if special `security.insecure` entitlement is enabled both by buildkitd configuration and allowed by the use

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

##

CVE-2024-23652
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

### Impact A malicious BuildKit frontend or Dockerfile using `RUN --mount` could trick the feature that removes empty files created for the mountpoints into removing a file outside the container, from the host system. ### Patches The issue has been fixed in v0.12.5 ### Workarounds Avoid using BuildKit frontend from an untrusted source or building an untrusted Dockerfile containing `RUN --mount`

jbhall56 at 2024-02-03T15:30:45.736Z ##

The flaws are collectively called Leaky Vessels and they are tracked as CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-23651, CVE-2024-23653 and CVE-2024-23652. https://www.securityweek.com/leaky-vessels-container-escape-vulnerabilities-impact-docker-others/

##
KyanHexagon at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.365Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

LedgerSMB@mastodon.social at 2024-02-02T18:10:13.000Z ##

LedgerSMB 1.11.9 and 1.10.31 released with security fix for CVE-2024-23831! Upgrades are highly advised. Easily run your accounting on Intel or ARM with docker images. For more see https://github.com/ledgersmb/LedgerSMB/releases/tag/1.11.9 and https://ledgersmb.org/cve-2024-23831-setup-csrf

##

CVE-2024-1059(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

Use after free in Peer Connection in Google Chrome prior to 121.0.6167.139 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit stack corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-02-02T00:26:31.682Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) pumped out 4 Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1077 Use after free in Network
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1059 Use after free in WebRTC
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1060 Use after free in Canvas
  • Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

CVE-2024-21399 (8.3 high severity, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H) is the oddball vulnerability not coming from the Google Chrome security advisory It's curiously marked RCE when Google has never used that to describe their vulnerabilities. Anyway, Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#Microsoft #MSRC #securityadvisory #vulnerability #Google #Chrome

##
simontsui at 2024-01-30T19:15:46.177Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 4 vulnerabilities fixed, 3 were externally reported. All three are high severity Use After Free in: Canvas (CVE-2024-1060), WebRTC (CVE-2024-1059), and Network (CVE-2024-1077). No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_30.html

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-02T00:26:31.000Z ##

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-1059 Use after free in WebRTC

##

CVE-2023-51820(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

An issue in Blurams Lumi Security Camera (A31C) v.2.3.38.12558 allows a physically proximate attackers to execute arbitrary code.

weddige@gruene.social at 2024-02-01T17:36:57.000Z ##

@faker great work! Was a firmware vulnerable to CVE-2023-51820 ever rolled out to the public?

##
faker at 2024-02-01T14:04:37.864Z ##

We have analyzed the security of a Blurams IoT camera.

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).
All vulnerabilities were fixed during the responsible disclosure process.

Read the detailed blog post here: https://infosec.rm-it.de/2024/02/01/blurams-lumi-security-camera-analysis/

##
weddige@gruene.social at 2024-02-01T17:36:57.000Z ##

@faker great work! Was a firmware vulnerable to CVE-2023-51820 ever rolled out to the public?

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T14:04:37.000Z ##

We have analyzed the security of a Blurams IoT camera.

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).
All vulnerabilities were fixed during the responsible disclosure process.

Read the detailed blog post here: https://infosec.rm-it.de/2024/02/01/blurams-lumi-security-camera-analysis/

During the research we were able to gain access to semi-live low resolution images from all online cameras and found a reliable way to compromise the device using the SD card slot (CVE-2023-50488 / CVE-2023-51820).

CVE-2024-2365
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

KyanHexagon at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.365Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

##
KyanHexagon@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-01T02:22:20.000Z ##

https://snyk.io/blog/leaky-vessels-docker-runc-container-breakout-vulnerabilities/

Snyk researchers identified four vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21626, CVE-2024-2365, CVE-2024-23653, and CVE-2024-23652) in core container infrastructure components that allow an attacker to escape the containers and gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. Synk has released two tools that serve as reference implementations for detecting exploit attempts. They also recommend watching for patches from container build and runtime vendors.

##

CVE-2024-0853(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

curl inadvertently kept the SSL session ID for connections in its cache even when the verify status (*OCSP stapling*) test failed. A subsequent transfer to the same hostname could then succeed if the session ID cache was still fresh, which then skipped the verify status check.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T13:34:35.000Z ##

the original #hackerone report for CVE-2024-0853 is now public: https://hackerone.com/reports/2298922

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T07:12:45.000Z ##

Learn about CVE-2024-0853 "OCSP verification bypass with TLS session reuse" here:

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-0853.html

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T13:34:35.000Z ##

the original #hackerone report for CVE-2024-0853 is now public: https://hackerone.com/reports/2298922

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-01-31T07:12:45.000Z ##

Learn about CVE-2024-0853 "OCSP verification bypass with TLS session reuse" here:

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-0853.html

##
alecm@alecmuffett.com at 2024-01-29T16:19:19.000Z ##

The Rust community are lovely but they definitely are worthy of the snark…

we will also reveal the details about CVE-2024-0853. A severity low issue (that would not have been avoided by us using another language)

https://mastodon.social/@bagder/111840075114342229

##

CVE-2023-49950(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

The Jinja templating in Logpoint SIEM 6.10.0 through 7.x before 7.3.0 does not correctly sanitize log data being displayed when using a custom Jinja template in the Alert view. A remote attacker can craft a cross-site scripting (XSS) payload and send it to any system or device that sends logs to the SIEM. If an alert is created, the payload will execute upon the alert data being viewed with that t

1 repos

https://github.com/shrikeinfosec/cve-2023-49950

shrikeinfosec at 2024-01-31T12:36:28.374Z ##

CVE-2023-49950: Stored XSS in Logpoint SIEM Alerts via Log Injection

Affects v6.1.0 through to v7.3.0.

https://servicedesk.logpoint.com/hc/en-us/articles/14124495377437-Stored-XSS-Vulnerability-in-Alerts-via-Log-Injection

The write-up about the vulnerability can be found here:

https://github.com/shrikeinfosec/cve-2023-49950/blob/main/cve-2023-49950.md
